data.title: Profile_middle_high
data.text:
Nathan received his Bachelor of Arts in History from the University of California: Davis and his teaching accreditation from California State University: Bakersfield. He taught World History at Stockdale High School before moving to Taiwan, where he's taught English and Social Studies since. Nathan has 18 years of instruction experience and currently teaches High School English Language Arts and Literature. He believes in a positive reinforcement approach to teaching, wishing to share the fascination and wonder of the wider world with his students and is intent on providing the language skills needed for such. His interests include music, puzzles, trivia and games.

George earned a Bachelor of Arts in Education from the University of Pretoria, majoring in Electronics and Technology. After graduation, he completed several advanced certifications in Robotics, IoT, and Computer Science at Carnegie Mellon University, the University of California, Irvine, and VEX Robotics. In the 1990s, he founded one of the first high school robotics clubs in Pretoria. More recently, the student robotics teams he coached have won regional competitions in Taiwan. His passion for teaching and expertise in STEM education continue to inspire his students and prepare them for the future. In his free time, George enjoys hiking and traveling.

Mrs Charita Koli is an Alumnus of Bombay University where she got her Bachelor's Degree in Science. She has gained recognition in Fostering Academic Success Through Cooperative Learning, Working Memory, and the Reflective Cycle from National Taiwan University of Science and Technology. She has been working as a professional science educator for Past 8 years in Taiwan. She brings with her a passion for active, inquiry-based learning aligned with the Next Generation Science Standards (NGSS). Her approach includes engaging students through phenomena-based experiences, encouraging them to ask questions, investigate problems, and propose solutions. She has successfully managed to connect science with math and STEM, foster collaborative discussions, and use technology to enhance learning. Her goal is to provide authentic scientific experiences that prepare students for success in college and their future endeavors.

Merlin graduated with honors with a Bachelor's degree in Physics from Mapua University, Manila, Philippines, and pursued his Masters in Space Science and Engineering at the National Central University, Taiwan. In addition to his scientific training, he also has a background in music as a violin major from the Philippine High School for the Arts and the University of the Philippines, College of Music. With more than a year of experience teaching Math and Physics to engineering students, his approach focuses on simplifying complex concepts to make them accessible, fostering curiosity and joy in learning. Merlin believes that nurturing a student's natural curiosity through exploration and encouraging them to find joy in discovering new concepts is the best way for them to learn. He currently teaches high school mathematics and advanced physics courses. In his free time, he enjoys listening to classical music, playing chess, and going to the gym.

Russell received a Bachelor of Arts from University of Otago. He also obtained a PGCE from Moreland University in America, TEFL through Hess Educational Organization in Taiwan, and his teaching license through the Hawaii Board of Education.

Russell has a total of twenty years of teaching/coaching experience; twenty years coaching martial arts, and thirteen years teaching language and science in Taiwan. He strongly believes that students grow best in a fun learning environment that allows them to step out of their comfort zones and make mistakes. People learn best from mistakes with an understanding of how to process their mistakes into lessons for future reference.

In his free time, Russell enjoys playing strategy games, especially chess, watching debates and lectures, carving, cycling and gaming.

Matt received a Bachelor of Arts in Political Science from Stanford University while earning All-American honors on the varsity swim team. He then went on to complete his Postgraduate Certificate in Education while student teaching at the American School in Japan. After teaching for two years at the International School of Ningbo, he moved to Taiwan and worked part-time at both Taipei American and Taipei European Schools. He currently teaches High School Social Studies. His interests include writing, swimming, and travel.

Joe Leard is an experienced educator with over fifteen years of teaching expertise across various educational levels, from primary to college students, as well as working professionals. Holding a Bachelor of Science in English and Writing with a minor in American History from Southern Oregon University, Joe has a diverse background in teaching ESL, American curriculum programs, and test preparation for international school entrance exams. He has developed and implemented specialized curricula in language arts, social studies, and writing, fostering students' skills in critical thinking, reading comprehension, and verbal reasoning. Currently, Joe leads Upper Limb Learning, where he prepares students for rigorous academic environments and helps them transition smoothly into English-based curricula.

Rick is a seasoned Mathematics educator with 20 years of teaching experience. He holds a BSc (Hons) in Mathematics from Liverpool University and a Postgraduate Certificate in Education from Southampton University. Before transitioning to education, Rick worked as a computer programmer specializing in website development.

An accomplished author, Rick has written books across various genres, with a strong focus on children's literature. His passion for rowing saw him compete in the first VIII for his university, and he has successfully coached students to the GB junior level. Outside the classroom, Rick enjoys music production, traveling, and spending quality time with his family.

Marcus is from the U.K. and received a master degree of Science in International Management from Swansea University in Wales, U.K. He has taught in Taiwan to students of all ages and abilities for 18 years. He obtained a teacher certification through Moreland University to become a licensed teacher in the state of Washington D.C. His teaching philosophy is focusing on creating a positive classroom climate and encouraging a student-centered classroom environment. In his free time he enjoys spending time with his family plus he enjoys working out, martial arts, movies and travel.

Damian Williams received his M.S. in Applied Linguistics from the University at Albany. He has since worked at a variety of settings, including university intensive English language programmes, various literacy initiatives for refugees and immigrants, and both public and international high schools in Taiwan. Most recently, he has worked as a student counsellor with NCUK, a pre-university progression in the UK, and has had students progress to universities in the UK, Australia, Italy, and New Zealand. He has also completed university counselling and admissions agent credentials in the UK, Australia, New Zealand, and the US, and is in the process of completing an IB Educator Certificate programme with the University of Windsor in Canada and a PGCE from Moreland University in the US. In his free time, he enjoys ice hockey, lakes, and saunas.

Indigo joined TYAS in 2018, She graduated from Tainan National University of Arts, majoring material arts and design, and she has been working as an illustrator and a ceramic artist for years. After being an artist-in-residency in US, now she is an assistant in the student affairs office in TYAS. She loves traveling, reading and making ceramic sculptures in her leisure time.
